wikipedia_page.main: George William Walker (30 May 1934 – 8 August 2012) was an English footballer who played as an inside forward. He scored 58 goals from 179 appearances in the Football League for Bristol City and Carlisle United before injury ended his career.

Along with former Carlisle United teammate George Walker, he set up Carlisle City in 1975.

The club was formed in 1975 by two former Carlisle United players, George Walker and Ron Thompson "to give local lads somewhere to play". They joined the Northern Alliance, and were runners-up in 1976–77 and 1977–78,Northern Alliance 1960-1979 Non-League Matters and again in 1979–80.Northern Alliance 1979-1990 Non-League Matters
